{docbook}
<abstract>
 <para>This chapter will help you understand what CMIS is, how it is extended in WCM, and its features via the following topics:</para>
    <itemizedlist>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.Overview">Overview</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Overall introduction to CMIS, xCMIS and eXo CMIS.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.Specification">CMIS specification</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Introduction to the CMIS specification and functions of a Web services interface which is provided by the CMIS specification. </para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.xCMIS_project">xCMIS project</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Introduction to the xCMIS project and its benefits.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.features">CMIS features</link>
          </emphasis></para>
        <para>Introduction to the CMIS features, including how to integrate with eXo WCM, CMIS Domain Model and CMIS Services.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Adm_CMIS.ServiceJARs">Service JARs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Additional information about a list of JARs used in eXo CMIS.</para>
      </listitem>
    </itemizedlist>
	</abstract>
{docbook}
